summary: The VA spent nearly $20 billion in 2015 to buy goods and services to serve veterans. However, its purchasing process may be inefficient and unnecessarily complex. We identified several factors that are preventing the VA from effectively managing this process, including incomplete data, outdated and fragmented policies, and not taking advantage of discounts. title: Veterans Affairs Contracting: Improvements in Policies and Processes Could Yield Cost Savings and Efficiency
